channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Rensselaer Dining Announces Closing Dates for BARH Renovation
item.description: Students living in the Burdett Avenue Residence Hall (BARH) should note that the dining hall will close for renovations beginning Saturday, November 23 and will remain closed until it reopens on Monday, January 6, 2025. Both Auxiliary Services and Rensselaer Dining appreciate the students’ patience as the dining hall gets its new look!
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications Now Open for 2024-2025 Barry Goldwater Scholarship
item.description: Established by Congress in 1986 to foster and encourage excellence in science and mathematics, the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation runs an educational scholarship program designed to provide opportunities for U.S. undergraduate students with strong academic records and outstanding research potential. The pre-application deadline is Monday, November 25, 2024; the final application deadline for nominated students is Monday, January 20, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: Van Sandt, Brucker to Lead EMPAC Tour
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 23, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:30 AM - Join Director for Stage Technologies Stephanie Van Sandt and Lead Video Engineer Eric Brucker in this behind-the-scenes tour highlighting all the nuts and bolts that make EMPAC’s spaces work, and learn about how technology and creativity meld in collaboration with artists in the creation of new work. No reservations are necessary for this public tour, which is free to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Nominations Now Open for Phalanx Honor Society
item.description: Date: Monday, November 25, 2024 12:00 AM - Nominations are now open for the Phalanx Honor Society, which has been active for over 100 years with the purpose of recognizing students, faculty, and staff who exemplify the three pillars of Leadership, Service, and Devotion to the Alma Mater. From now through November 25, please consider taking a moment to nominate a peer, colleague or friend for this special honor!…
item.author: Community

item.title: “Four Steps to Effective Communication: Extended DISC” Topic of Fall Graduate Lunch & Learn Workshop
item.description: Date: Wednesday, December 4, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:30 PM - The Extended DISC system is based on behavioral theories that have been used for over one hundred years. In this workshop, presented by Will Fahey, Manager of Professional and Organizational Development, participants will complete an Extended DISC questionnaire and receive individualized reports that reflect both their “natural” and “adjusted” behavioral styles, and learn strategies that promote successful interactions with others.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Music Lecture with Dr. Scott Oshiro Slated for November 22
item.description: Come to Sage 3303 at 5:00PM on November 22 for a lecture with Bay Area-based flautist and music technology researcher Dr. Scott Oshiro as he discusses ongoing research into the use of quantum computers for creating and understanding music. As an African and Okinawan American, Scott’s creative and academic work incorporates influences from his heritage and combines them with jazz, hip hop, and electronic music.
item.author: Community

item.title: Mueller Center to Host Thanksgiving Dinner During Break
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 28, 2024 11:30 AM - 2:00 PM - If you’ll be staying on campus this Thanksgiving Break, you’re invited to join the Mueller Center for its annual Thanksgiving Dinner in the Union McNeil Room! Please register in advance to ensure there will be enough food for all; contact Donna Sutton if you have any questions.

item.title: UPDATE: Sport Courts Grand Opening Postponed
item.description: Date: Friday, November 22, 2024 12:00 AM - Due to inclement weather, this event has been postponed until the spring semester. Contact the Mueller Center with any questions or concerns!

item.title: Bid on one of a kind model of the original Chicago Ferris Wheel
item.description: You can own a one of a kind model of the original Chicago Ferris Wheel. The model can be viewed in the Folsom Library. Bidding ends on Monday 11/25/2024 at 11:11am ET. All proceeds benefit the United Way. Please click in announcement for link providing additional information to this United Way Silent Auction including bidding rules and to scan the QR code to place your bid. Bid high, bid often.

item.title: United Way Holiday Wreath, Poinsettia Sale Open Through November 26
item.description:
Date: Thursday, November 7, 2024 11:00 AM - Tue , November 26, 2024 11:00 AM - The annual United Way Holiday Wreath and Poinsettia pre-order sale is now open through Tuesday, November 26! You must submit your order form with payment by Tuesday, November 26; pickup will be during the Armory’s community fair/supplier showcase between the hours of 11 a.m. and 2 p.m. on Thursday, December 5.
